content.question:
<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
<math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>
<math alttext="fraction numerator square root of 2 over denominator 2 end fraction"><mfrac><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="negative fraction numerator square root of 2 over denominator 2 end fraction"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="fraction numerator square root of 3 over denominator 2 end fraction"><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="negative 1 half"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

The table gives ordered pairs <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> that are close together and satisfy the equation in two variables <math alttext="x squared plus y squared equals 1"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. Which of the following statements is true for an interval of the graph of <math alttext="x squared plus y squared equals 1"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane containing these two points?

choices.label: The rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>.
The rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> is undefined.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
